This was intense.  Just a note that it wasn't HIIT, which is what I was expecting when the words High Intensity were in the title. There were no 10-20 second breaks that I look forward to with HIIT. It had several unique moves, and was definitely total body.  I liked the reverse lunge flying into warrior three.  I also appreciated the standing pike, as I have diastasis recti, and can't do crunches on the floor.  I had to modify the one armed down dog into reverse fly, as it was rough on my shoulders.  Overall, it was a good work out.

Side note: any tips for helping with wrist pain during some of the plank moves??

I would suggest when doing plank moves,  pressing into all 10 finger points of your hands. Making sure your wrists are underneath your shoulders and pressing out of your foundation with your hands when your in a plank. So when you're doing a plank move, your hands are not collapsing in and putting weight into your wrists. This is something I do that helped me stop the wrist pain, I hope that made sense!  x

I did this workout yesterday and it was ah-maze-ing!  First Kit is the best instructor.  Every movement is so targeted.  I was working muscles I didn't know I had.  But it is also so intense your heart rate will spike like crazy.  I was dripping sweat.  Full disclosure I have stated on here before that I am going through treatment for breast cancer and I am still doing surgeries and chemotherapy so I am not as fit as I once was, there were things that were so hard like the plank move where you hug yourself and move your arm out, I just do not have the strength yet. But even doing some modifications I loved the intensity of this workout.  ALSO very happy to see Dani back on the videos!!!
